{"step_by_step_thinking": "Royal jelly proteins and yellow proteins are both produced by bees. However, they serve different functions and are produced in different glands. Royal jelly proteins are secreted by the hypopharyngeal glands of worker bees and are a major component of royal jelly, which is fed to larvae and queen bees. On the other hand, yellow proteins are produced in the fat bodies of bees and are components of bee venom and pollen. Therefore, despite both being produced by bees, they are not similar.", "answer_choice": "B. no"}
